title: Tailwind Advanced Assessment
description: Comprehensive assessment covering key concepts from the tailwind-advanced module

questions.question: What is Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides low-level utility classes to build designs without writing custom CSS.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: How do you add padding to an element in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: In Tailwind, p-* classes are used for padding. The number represents the spacing scale where p-4 equals 1rem (16px).
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: How does Tailwind's mobile-first responsive design approach work?
questions.explanation: Tailwind uses a mobile-first approach where unprefixed classes apply to all screen sizes, and responsive prefixes (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:) apply to specific breakpoints and larger screens. This means styles stack as the screen size increases.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: Which class is used to create a flex container in Tailwind?
questions.explanation: The flex class creates a flex container in Tailwind CSS, enabling flexbox layout for its children.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: Where do you customize Tailwind's default theme?
questions.explanation: Tailwind's configuration file (tailwind.config.js) is where you customize the default theme, add plugins, and configure other options.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: How do you make text bold in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: The font-bold class makes text bold in Tailwind CSS. Tailwind uses the font-* naming convention for font weight utilities.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: What are the default breakpoints in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: Tailwind's default breakpoints are: sm (640px), md (768px), lg (1024px), xl (1280px), and 2xl (1536px). These can be customized in the tailwind.config.js file.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: How do you set a background color to blue-500 in Tailwind?
questions.explanation: In Tailwind, background colors are set using the bg-* naming convention, so bg-blue-500 sets the background color to the 500 shade of blue.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: How do you add custom colors to Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: Custom colors are added by extending the theme configuration in tailwind.config.js, which generates utility classes for your custom color palette.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: What is PurgeCSS and why is it important for Tailwind?
choices: Removes unused CSS classes to reduce bundle size
questions.explanation: PurgeCSS (now built into Tailwind) removes unused utility classes from the final CSS bundle, dramatically reducing file size from hundreds of KB to just a few KB.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: How do you implement dark mode in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: Enable dark mode by setting darkMode: 'class' in config, then use dark: prefixed utilities like 'bg-white dark:bg-gray-800'. Toggle by adding/removing 'dark' class on document element.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: What is the @apply directive used for in Tailwind?
choices: Applying utility classes in custom CSS
questions.explanation: @apply allows you to use Tailwind utilities within custom CSS classes, useful for creating component classes while maintaining utility-first approach.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: How does Tailwind handle responsive design?
choices: Mobile-first breakpoint prefixes (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:)
questions.explanation: Tailwind uses mobile-first responsive design with breakpoint prefixes that apply styles at specific screen sizes and larger.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: What are Tailwind plugins and how do they extend functionality?
questions.explanation: Tailwind plugins extend the framework by adding new utilities, components, or base styles. Official plugins include @tailwindcss/forms, @tailwindcss/typography, and @tailwindcss/aspect-ratio. Custom plugins can add project-specific utilities.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: What is a recommended approach for managing long utility class lists?
choices: Extract to component classes or use @apply
questions.explanation: For maintainability, extract frequently used utility combinations into component classes using @apply, or create framework-specific components that encapsulate the styling.
questions.industryContext: These skills are valuable in professional development environments.

questions.question: What are the advanced techniques for building scalable design systems with Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: Advanced techniques include: creating configurable component variants using utility combinations, implementing consistent design tokens through Tailwind config customization, using CSS-in-JS libraries like styled-components with Tailwind, leveraging @apply directive for complex patterns, implementing staggered animations with CSS custom properties, optimizing bundle size with PurgeCSS, and building reusable component libraries with variant APIs.
questions.industryContext: Advanced Tailwind patterns are essential for large-scale applications and design system implementation in enterprise environments.
